AaQK5jA7P-mI_xv-9XrfVA.text: One of my favorite place for the english breakfast.Food good, service so and so, amazing style, not good the queue during the weekend.But really recommended!

O6DfU29kod2EUBEoPioarw.text: Awesome vibe. very much like the design and food is good. Try bacon pancakes, I now, sounds like worst combination, but it is delicios

zWsLLYAVoRxbQFHQtzdDgw.text: This place is a solid 3.  It looks like an American Dinner and has a menu to match.  We made reservations, so we were able to walk past all the people in line waiting for a table.  We had some apps and happy hour drinks; fried feta, rocket salad, veggie mac & cheese, and falafel.  The food was good, but the drinks were just sugar....WAY too sweet.  I apparently ordered the one that was not sweet at all and it was like sucking on a sugar cane.  Couldn't taste the alcohol at all.

VFxWbuVUlvLGyaXGlrSqVA.text: Sonic the Hedgehog and Commodore 64 in the corner? Hipster decor, check!This place was cute.  Came here around 8:30 on a Thursday and it was packed, but we were able to get a table for 2 within 15 minutes.  Ordered the £13 Turkey Trimmings- turkey, sprouts with bacon, potatoes, cabbage, and mashed sweet potatoes, and the £9Chicken Burger.  Both were decent but forgettable.  Come to get hangover food after a few rounds at Mayor of Scaredy Cat Town, instead of too seek mind blowing food.  Morning Mojito was way too strong and sweet.

fQrh1G_XQYxNhkUggyYa0g.text: This place, much like it's cousins in Angel and Soho, serves up generously proportioned American style breakfasts. It's not gourmet, and if you don't expect it to be, you wont be disappointed.Their juices, squeezed to order and in interesting combinations (apple and ginger, anyone?) and their iced coffees are to die for.[somewhat and only by comparison] less busy than Angel/Soho locations, but still rammed -- be prepared for a wait.

hxAnxn_6FeN5mR03wliV5Q.text: i wish everybody i know would stop loving this place, because i seriously don't like it and keep getting forced to come back. every time i'm here i spend loads of money on some overpriced meal that i have a bite of and then realize i hate and then i hate myself for ordering it and falling into that stupid trap again. last time i was here, i got some breakfast burrito with huge chunks of chorizo and loads of meaty grease. i was super pumped for it, but sadly the guacamole on the side was the only part i liked. i ended up giving away the burrito and my smoothie, which tasted like blended oats.. waste of money :[ also - i was told the bloody marys here were life changing and they sounded amazing on the menu, but they weren't. the best thing about them was the giant celery stalk that they come with. luckily i got to eat that, since everything else i tried was crap. and yeah, the fridge thing is cool, but it doesn't save this place for me. if i had my way, i wouldn't be back but i know i will since my friends all think the sun shines out this place's ass and that every meal from here will automatically cure your hangover. they're obviously of lower intelligence than me, but it's all cool

tRdex3A9nSvvZiiz6Vf4TA.text: For the first time in well over a year I walked past The Breakfast Club in Spitalfields and there wasn't a queue, I grab my other halves hand and said to him 'We're eating here!' Luckily he trust me when it comes to picking the places we chow down at, and he wasn't disappointed at all.The atmosphere is buzzing, despite being nearly 10pm on a Tuesday night, and the decor made me feel as though I was in America. I felt totally at home instantly. The menu had loads to choose from, including an all day breakfast so the place really lives up to its name. My burrito was probably the best I'd even tried, filled to the brim with chicken, rice, all your sauces and salad. It was so large I struggled to finish, which is saying a lot for someone with my appetite! My other half had a chicken and bacon and sandwich, and I had never seen so much filling! It wasn't filled with salad either; it was pure chicken and bacon with a splash of barbecue sauce! It looked simply divine!We had no room at all to fit in desert, but they sounded awesome. May have to pop them on my 'to try' list if we can ever get a table again! Drinks were reasonable priced, and staff were really lovely too.I would really recommend trying the food here, you get a lot for your money, and I was certainly filled to the brim, which is quite rare for me. If you can get there early enough of a weekend rumour has it that their breakfasts work wonders for your hangover from the night before.And don't forget to ask to see the Mayor!

lxRWZWi1uYeQIiXPd01Iig.text: As a Canadian living in London i was craving something other then the standard fair that most breakfast joints around town are serving.. something a little more original or creative.. or as I realized later a little more like home. I came on a week day so it was busy but I didn't have to wait in line. I ordered a coffee which I have to say was really freaking good. As i sipped it, it slowly revealed I love BC, which i automatically thought of my home province (British Columbia), but knew it had to do with the Breakfast Club. I ordered the full veg breakfast. I loved the veg sausage and maple agave syrup the most. The pancakes tasted like they had been made the day before and microwaved and reserved. Also my food came so fast I knew it was almost all pre made which makes me question the quality. I am not unreasonable and I know it is hard to serve a restaurant full of people always 'fresh' food but just so you know it isn't made to order.. it's already made and being reheated.Decor was great, and the guys working were super nice.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. I love BC

fxkwfAquIwAJWFwi6QTAlA.text: "I can't believe you haven't heard of The Breakfast Club!" my new, slightly too cool London friend exclaimed when she said we should meet there.Listen lady, I'm an Australian living in the sunshine capital of the world, Edinburgh. THE FUCK would I hear about a brunch spot in London? I know and love the movie. This place better be good.And muy bueno! So much better than the lacklustre Yelp star rating would indicate. This place was absolute tits. Yep, the wait for a table was a little longer than my distressed stomach would have liked but everything else was at least 4-star worthy. My breakfast burrito bitch-slapped my stomach back into submission. Our staff-lady was lovely. She gave the hoped-for knowing smirk when I asked for the whoriest bloody mary possible at 11am on a Sunday. The price was absolutely reasonable. I absolutely recommend this place for oft-needed hungover fry-up. And the music is awesome.

dYmRJMgdN81K7ykjs3uplg.text: Great atmosphere and cool music, menu has a wide selection and the smoothies are delicious! The pancakes were amazing, warm and fluffy as they should be.

Mehr8ThhBowe3Iz6b0-3UA.text: Had to wait awhile in line to get in but food was well worth the wait! I had the chorizo, egg and potatoes with Feta...flavors were awesome but i could not eat it all.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

C_lPWh3zEoYs_v13yMuZUw.text: Yes, I know it's weird but I don't like cheese. The waitress asked me 3 times if I really, really, really wanted my cheeseburger without cheese cos there ain't no plain burger option.Apart from that, I must say that the burger was great: big slab of meat and fantastic, crunchy fries to go with that.I love the quirky decor, the buzz, the originality of the place. Go check it out!

1OjpxXip_tlTMGKPaPfAWQ.text: It's a nice enough space but really, if you want breakfast there are a lot better and cheaper places around here to get it.  So really it's more of a bar come diner and you can do a lot better around here for these too.Not impressed.

wVLyPPXxSRniJD8TJPV4wQ.text: The last addition to the branches of The Breakfast Club in London was the place chosen to have brunch on my birthday, and I was truly looking forward to it. A friend of mine works here and I salivated every time she described a new dish she got to try. And she was indeed right. I chose the pancakes & berries, a huge, unstable and scrumptious tower of 4 thick pancakes covered in maple syrup, berries and vanilla cream, that was amazing. Seriously, the yummiest thing I've tried for a while (it helped that I was quite hungry, I must admit). My partner got eggs benedict, that were very good as well. For drink, a iced soya latte and freshly squeezed orange juice, that were fine. I was really happy we came here.It was early when we came in, around noon, but the place started to fill up when we left. I've been told that on weekends people queue outside before they open for breakfast, and that for lunch on weekdays it gets very busy as well. After trying it, I'm not surprised at all.Also, the decor, menu and general vibe are quite cool, and the staff is lovely (not only my friend, who wasn't there at that time!). Now I have to go and try the drinks on the other side of the Smeg fridge ^^

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

RglNDhXUGp5PW-B-eZZB7g.text: The queue/wait to get in here was very quick, which was very much appreciated!  Prices were average - around £4-9 for a brunch dish.   Portions were just the right size.  In terms of the food: I ordered the Reggie the Veggie, which had veggie sausages (which tasted like meat sausages - crazy how that is possible!), beans, poached eggs, toast, one portobello mushroom top and hashbrowns.  Hashbrowns were great, the others were average.  The wait staff was a little bit inattentive - when we were ordering our server got pretty frazzled that we asked for our dishes before our drinks, and then forgot to bring water to our table.  Liked the quirky decor - lots of retro memorabilia and lots of random notes hung all over the restaurant..  Probably a good place to go if close by, after a late night.  Otherwise, pretty average.

QxcFfqj7J2xEUz3VrBtwXg.text: Terrible!  The food was bad and the service was worse.  I'm gutted that we chose to spend our Thanksgiving here and am shocked at how awful it truly was.1.  The booking - we had to call 3 different times and email a bunch of times (plus sketchily put down a credit card with some random person to hold the booking) in order to confirm the table.  Nobody knew what was going on when we called to book and they kept telling us to send an email.  It took forever to get a response.  Super unprofessional.2.  The restaurant - the decor is fine, but the music was jacked up so loud that we couldn't really hear.3.  The service - downright shameful.  It was soooo slow (and the restaurant wasn't even that busy).  It took forever to get someone to take our order, then ages to get the drinks (which came out wrong), then ages to get the right drinks, then ages to get our first course.  My dining partner was concerned that the restaurant would run out of pumpkin cheesecake (her main concern on Thanksgiving is, naturally, to have something pumpkin!).  She asked the waiter to please reserve a piece of the pumpkin cheesecake for her.  He told her that it'd be fine and that there was no danger of running out.Nobody came around to check on us and we sat over 30 minutes between our first and second courses.  The second course (which was our Thanksgiving dinner with turkey (or mac&cheese) and the fixings) came out cold.  Cold!  When we brought this to the waiter's attention, he told us to hang on a minute while he settled the bill up with two other tables.  He finally returned to our table and asked us what we'd like him to do about our cold meals.  We asked him to please warm them, which took another 15 minutes.  My dining partner asked the waiter again to please put in her order for a piece of the pumpkin cheesecake and he assured her that there wouldn't be a problem.After we finished eating (or tried to finish eating - the food was nearly inedible), we waited and waited for them to clear our plates and bring dessert.  Finally, the waiter cleared our plates.  We sat.  And sat.  And sat.  Then the waiter came over and informed us that all of the pumpkin cheesecake was gone.  We thought he was joking.  Nope.  In the nearly 2 hours it took him to serve us a mediocre dinner (that they clearly microwaved to warm up after it came out cold), they were out of the pumpkin.  We had no choice but to take the apple and pecan pies, which were absolutely awful.  You could get something better at the grocery store.4.  The food - as I mentioned above, the food was awful.  I had the macaroni and cheese, which was, literally, boxed Kraft mac&cheese with a little grated cheese on top.  It came out of the kitchen cold (not even lukewarm), the noodles were so overcooked they were falling apart, and it was tasteless.  I was shocked that they would serve something like that in a restaurant!  The mac&cheese came with some oily/burnt potatoes, brown carrots that looked like they were rotting, some strange cabbage, dry/stale cornbread, and a sweet potato puree.  It was the kind of meal they might serve you in a prison or an old-folks home.  Actually, the food we had was probably worse.  The pies were soggy with thick crusts and undercooked fruit.I was beyond disappointed by our meal.  We brought up our concerns to the waiter, but he didn't do anything about them.  Luckily, I had nice company and friends to be with, but the meal was just sad.  It is really a shame because we were looking to celebrate our Thanksgiving with a nice meal out, but instead ended up with cold food and indigestion.  I'm going to go back to cooking at home next Thanksgiving!

mciNDvwgyHwftpOgNY5YeQ.text: We ordered the banana and bacon French toast and the half Monty. All was delicious, but the service was slow and they were out of soy milk and beet juice on a Thursday morning. Weird.

XIYgizAMCFL9OFXniaQMHQ.text: Used to be amazing. They still do great coffee but are just too busy. If you get there after 1045am on weekends the queue is crazy. Food isnt bad. But ... the standard has dropped. Used to get a huge amount of avocado on the "avocado and chilli on toast" but they seem to have literally halved the portion size. Still. Its not bad and I'm sure other patrons will enjoy the atmosphere (just be sure to get there early enough to avoid the queue).

2I0A-CJI8amZrlO9IhrPBA.text: The food is absolutely delicious, mostly accurately American, and reasonably priced-especially for London. This Breakfast Club location (plus the bar downstairs) also sports the best service I've ever had, anywhere, period.  The wait staff are extremely warm, friendly, attentive, and willing to accommodate their customers whatever the case may be. Overall fantastic experience.

06ZtgnrmZVfFQc7SF3Zj4A.text: How fun! I, being an American, was kinda confused when the Londoner friends I was with wanted to take my friend and I to an American-esque restaurant. But, to my delight, the English twist on American comfort food (and breakfast) was delightful. I had barbeque pulled pork on a sandwich and coleslaw and fries and my friend had pancakes with berries and whipped cream. The whole time we ate, they kept saying there was a surprise. Later on, we asked to see "the mayor" (which we were really confused about) and, again to my delight, we were escorted to a fabulous, classy, dark, mood-lit bar in the basement. The drinks we had here were among the best hand crafted cocktails I've ever had the privilege of delighting my taste buds with. The Old Fashion was perfection and I watched as the barkeep lovingly hand-made our cocktails to perfection. She took her time making these beautiful drinks and it was a grand success! What a fun evening. One I will always remember.

9D5Ei4pkSuGSJhHAS01r2w.text: My first stop of the day, I came here to try of great is the breakfast.Extremely busy, I waited a half hour before being seated. And needed to wait again after to place my order. no need to say it is noisy here.The menu is full interesting items that seem to be reasonably priced. Except the drinks.  I ordered I the beetlejuice (beetroot, apple, ginger, carrot), worth the price finally.I tried the vegetarian pancakes. Great choice, I liked the veggie sausage. And it was so tasty and great to mix potatoes and vegetables with the pancakes and their maple syrup.Staff remain friendly even they are so busy.The bill remained light.

nW0u61CAYnDrbaOIDP68FA.text: Great place, retro diner style, chilled atmosphere. Amazing food...I was there for an evening event. Three courses and drinks. The food made our night! Drinks were great and staff were very friendly and helpful! Looking forward to going again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Steak & chips :)

JuzDfpGbvocnQlta5P_yAg.text: Awesome vibe-casual, buzzing. Amazing tunes, extensive menu and drink list.Worth being prepared to queue. Place has wow factor straight away. The menu is so long-I wanted to order everything!Fresh juices are so good.

EgeXsEGGk94xo5_61fpGlw.text: Although I've wanted to try this place for a while it's only recently I managed. It was worth the wait. The food was lovely and the staff were very pleasant and genuine. We then saw the Mayor for some of the best cocktails I've had. A special mention to George who made my an off menu cocktail which is a particular favourite of mine. I loved the fact the venue was quite small and intimate without being crowded, as most places would like to just "pack them in". Can't wait to go back...,

EEg2mcIJhuAYPGl9NzbAeQ.text: Nice interior, friendly service. Wonderful elaborate brunch-menu. Perfectly poached eggs. We'll meet again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Entrance to the speakeasy!
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast room
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

ZJyIQKxwhupGO13_1AGgWw.text: Food was fine, but the service was very poor. One bearded waiter spent his time directing customers to the two worst tables in a half empty restaurant. He was very rude, and dealt with our request for a different table as a personal affront, completely ruined our visit, I will not be back.

DIQjywRTgsWWZopNGdUSZg.text: Went here to get a proper American breakfast. Which wasn't exactly what we expected. The portions were okay but not as big as America, which was fine. Went with all my American friends who wanted to get a little taste of home. The berry smoothie we all shared was fantastic and the food was wonderful. Can I just say, they have the most amazing bacon. I also had their eggs florentine, which was so yummy! My friends were plenty happy with their cinnamon apple French toast as well! Looking forward to eating here again! Not to mention really sweet workers are all at The Breakfast Club!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs florentine, so delicious!

lo6LLK7GVitjzR0V9lsFgA.text: Interesting and fun interior but the food was meh.  I had a train to catch in a hour at Liverpool Street station and decided to have breakfast food as my dinner.  I had the Mexican Mac which is your usual mac n cheese with a mexican twist, with tomatoes and jalepenos and chillies. The concept sounds like it will work but the result is not that impressive.  I have also been to the Soho one and was always wondering what the long line is about.  Perhaps its popularity is a function of how few brunch places there are in town but compared to brunch food in america, it is honestly a bit overrated.  There is a speakeasy in the basement and you go through the fridge door to get there, then you exit through the doors to the bathrooms.  I could not help notice hordes of people, men and women all coming out from the bathroom doors every 5 to 10 mins =)  Seems like a cool and fun speakeasy, have to go back and try.

7PkmRM7VH13Ijy14Tzz6yg.text: I loved the decor, I loved the fridge, I loved what's behind the fridge. But the food, didn't really work for me and I love breakfast food! I do!I've tried their pancakes american style and I don't understand how potatoes and pancakes work. I left much of it! also potatoes and maple syrup. Not sure about that combo!Then I went back to try their mac and cheese which was really bland. and I left like 70% of it. This is not good. especially, after a few cocktails at the Mayor.(I'm trying to find the best mac and cheese in London) But the mayor is what we're here for. *wink*

Z4TBjfxqINXs2octVSFafw.text: Once when I came here, I ordered pancakes with maple syrup and bacon. Vile! I'm normally quite receptive to trying sweet and savoury tastes mixed together, but there was a whole pool of very cheap tasting maple syrup, and they had dredged the dish with so much icing sugar that I felt like my teeth would drop out before we left the restaurant. The taste of bacon was so obliterated by the overwhelming sweetness of everything else that it might as well have not even been there.However, I have since (reluctantly) been back with work colleagues. Learning from my previous mistake, I ordered the scrambled eggs with smoked salmon and avocado on toast, which I really couldn't fault. The portion was generous, but so delicious that I just had to finish it.I'd say that there are a few hit and miss options on this menu, but each to their own. It does seem as though there is something for everyone here, my advice would be to pick carefully and avoid busy times. Apart from that, it's quite a nice place to share some food with a few friends or workmates.

6-uxrxOdCD1wlTO9s9YlKQ.text: Come to this place for the awesome American style brunches (waffles, bacon, granola, smoothies & bloody Mary's) or check out the hidden bar downstairs through the smeg fridge.The 80s decor will make you want to relive your youth! Get there early to miss tht queues for brunch!

4emGHRs_QPXfXRi8UEkpIQ.text: Food is yum. Peanut butter milkshake(either wuth or without banana) is to die for. Only bad thing is the queue is an absolute joke. Everytime I've gone I've had to wait over half an hour. It's like if you book a table it.. it makes no difference because you still find yourself waiting around. Service is pretty ok. You a tiller left waiting for a wee while though sometimes.

ER-PvLmGbAmLwh2T1AKjfg.text: Got there and after a ok wait in the queue we got a table. We enjoyed the full Monty and the all vegetarian pancakes. Both was really nice and plenty. The service was good and food arrived quickly. You've got to like the theme and the music. If you like you'll have really good breakfast.

nMf1VP_7hqj7GH_q5mCbtQ.text: The venue is super interesting, good crowd, but the food was just OK. The Boston beans were not bad at all. Just meh.

hYXpld4N8A991-AXjdOnXA.text: First visit to the Breakfast club.  Quirky decor, fun atmosphere and great food.  breakfast club is a very popular venue with very few empty tables.Not the quietest place for a business meeting with a customer but definitely worth a visit.

7x6O99mjdb8iCbiHBYxYrQ.text: The pancakes are great and well made. The eggs benedict had dry ham and wasn't seasoned well. Chicken and waffles makes me think that the only thing London knows how to fry is fish. The smoothies and juices were very good and healthy. Ambience was good and happening. Will come back again to give it another chance.

AMLqwOeeJNxJnQ0QS-BY6Q.text: Always a queue outside so that has to count for something! Inside is decorated in a rather eclectic way. As you queue you are greeted with pictures of previous diners strung up on old metal school pegs and disposable cameras so you can take your own to be added to the collection. The school theme continues into the restaurant with booths made from the little benches that used to accompany school pegs back in the day. Their brunch menu offers pretty much anything your hungry little tum desires and is served all day long. They also have a great Lunch & Dinner menu and a secret bar behind the fridge door (I can't tell you anymore than that it's so secret!) It loses a point as, in my opinion, the drinks prices are quite steep.

8mQ2FaYlpr8ZV35tGXM2cQ.text: When I initially heard about this place, I thought it was a tribute to the well knows 80s film... Well it's definitely 80s and it's definitely a tribute. Whilst you chow down on your american inspired brekkie, you can play the finest retro game known to man, yes, 'sonic the hedgehog' every 80s babies fav! I noticed another table playing Jenga also... This place serves up eggs Benedict, pancakes, burgers, wraps, a full English, yoghurt, milkshakes, latte... You want it, they got it! To enhance your 80s experience your ears are comforted by the best in 80s music (all genres included). At my recent visit, I took a bite of my buttery smoothered toast and as it slid did my gullet was welcomed by soul 2 soul - back to life! (Absolute classic!!). Possibly the best brekkie experience ever. As I bobbed my head, I listened closer for other tunes! Beware the secret American style fridge that leads to a downstairs cocktail bar! Yes, that's right, you walk through a fridge to get to an 80s inspired cocktail bar!  In a prime location down a side street, be prepared for a little wait! Venue is fab, with lots of cool memorabilia. Staff are very friendly and accommodating... You could quietly stay there for hours to your stomachs content! Prices are average for the quality and experience. Portions are nice but as my food was served luke warm, I was a little disappointed. Nice place to go for your breakfast but make sure your food is piping hot!

5-lISJ2Wk4EOEAw9kZsyHg.text: Great to get a full English at 11:30 on a weekday.  Service a little slow but not too bad.  The atmosphere is hipster/chain - just interesting enough to be comfortable, not chain enough to be obtrusive.  Diverse crowd - from suited businessmen to a variety of multi-ethnic twentysomethings - which is great.

t3HWEsoTtNrInj-iOA0mrQ.text: A good attempt but falls a bit sharp of the exceptional breakfast mark in my book. I had avocado on toast with chorizo. My husband had the full Monty. Both were good but not amazing especially for the rather steep prices.

wJO2S34ySYapgdSHAIBQSA.text: I really enjoyed the atmosphere and decor. It's nothing fancy, of course. It's just...fun. You walk in and see knick-knacks pinned up by the customers while you briefly wait for your host to seat you. The tables are slatted wooded, the floor is concrete, the music being pumped in is pop-rock-alternative, and the patrons were all ages. The food was very good and comforting; fresh squeezed orange juice (you walk right by the juicer on your way in) and my latte was perfect. I ordered the Royale Eggs (or Eggs Royale?) which were two perfectly poached eggs on English muffins, and Hollandaise sauce (see photo). It took a little too long for our check to arrive, but I wasn't in a hurry to leave.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Royale (or Royale Eggs) were extremely satisfying!

acUVSrIGP6BG_TnooPWT2A.text: When one of my friends asked me to describe in few words what I wanted to do for my birthday I said: friends, food, drinks and adventure. She booked a table at the breakfast club, with the intention of moving on from dinner to a meeting with the mysterious mayor of scaredy cat town. I liked the food reasonably well, but wouldn't list it among the best things I have eaten in this category of food and price range. The thing that made me laugh was that in accordance with its name, breakfast is served. Always. One of my friends, who had a rather strange rhythm of life at this moment, craved a night breakfast. So while I was enjoying my green salad, he got to enjoy a huge American breakfast. Breakfast with a cocktail, who wouldn't want that? I would totally return for the cocktails and should I ever crave eggs Benedict at night, I know where to go.While service was good at dinner time, we felt a bit disappointed when we wanted to meet the mayor. It was a popular day for this incredible mystery, but I feel they should have told us that the waiting time was outrageously long for groups. Because waiting and seeing people entering the bar when they haven't waited isn't fun. This is why we ultimately decided to leave the place to go elsewhere.

h5d3r4hn-gEGQCsvQPy98Q.text: American style pancakes?  Yes please!  As an American, sometimes I really long for something familiar from the motherland.  So when my friend (a fellow American) suggested The Breakfast Club because she had their pancakes and said they were wonderful, I decided, I'd put it on my list.  I knew they had different locations and since I was going to be out by this particular one... I decided I would try this location.I almost walked right past it and actually wasn't sure if the yellow, unmarked door was the entrance.  When I walked in, there was loud music playing, and loads of... stuff everywhere.  There were quite a few tables open, so I figured wouldn't have to wait.  Except I did... for a waitress to acknowledge I was standing there.  One of them made eye contact with me... so she had to come over.  I know, bummer.  Anyway she proceeds to say, "Do you mind sharing a table?"  Before I get off topic with a rant about how solo diners get treated...  let's just say I was not pleased with the other tables available.  I said, "Uh, I guess so..." and gave her a look.  And before she sat me with a couple (a couple... how awkward could that possibly get), she took me back toward the door and found me high top table to sit at.I was on a mission... pancakes, so even though there were other items catching my eye, I would complete my mission.  Originally I had thought to just order pancakes straight up... kind of like a whisky neat, but my gut (or my hungry tummy) was urging me to the All-American, which did have pancakes included.  Perfect.  The waitress who was serving me was very friendly and attentive... not sure if it was pity because I was eating breakfast on my own or because she was really interested in chatting to me, but it was kind of nice to talk about a couple of book recommendations and shopping recommendations.My food came out (I posted a picture).  It was quite a bit, but it was pretty good.  The bacon (streaky bacon) was as I like it... almost to the point of crispy, but still a bit chewy.  The sausage was an English sausage, which I prefer to American sausage (I hear you stifling your giggles... pervs).  The hash browns were not what I know as hash browns though.  Where I am from, we would call these home fries, but they were good.  Now... the pancakes.  They were the disappointment of my meal.  Something was a bit off, they kind of tasted like cardboard and the maple syrup didn't taste like real or fake maple syrup to me... just a sweet syrup.I don't know if I'll be back, it wasn't awful, but it didn't quite live up to expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The All-American

vxSvVqrrE6DEWlwi_XePXA.text: Now the name has become more well known in London, it seems to be more of a tourist trap than a restaurant committed to quality. Which really is a shame.   The menu doesn't seem to have changed in years, possibly since it opened, and while the smoothies are lovely and the staff (usually) friendly, it's just sad to see that everything else has slipped.   The best part of The Breakfast Club is the neon signs and nostalgic decor of 80's throw back video games and knick knacks. Also the 'smallest disco in the world' toilets are pretty neat.

8sZYUJf_4qNABQE86P8dwA.text: I really wanted to love this place as I frequently get American style brunch cravings and brunch, as I have often complained, has not quite caught on here in London just yet. Fingers crossed that TBC marks the beginning of a quiet revolution though...I've been here a few times now, first with a friend who was showing me around my new stomping grounds, a couple of times for meetings with clients and a few times for pleasure too.Now this place is quite hidden away near Liverpool St station and has (or so I hear) a speakeasy style bar tucked away inside a Smeg fridge converted into a door. It's not difficult to find really but certainly is not the kind of place you may stumble upon as a tourist wandering around the area.I usually order an American full, although I have to admit I can't actually remember if that's what it's called now... 1 sausage, a slice of bacon, two pancakes, scrambled eggs, home style hash browns (think bubble and squeak) came to about £9. Coffee and juice on top of that and it's a close to £15 per head affair which I feel is a little on the pricy side considering the portions are not so generous.It would be delightful to see some real American classics on the menu, pancakes and bacon are great but what about french toast and bacon, waffles and bacon or even... chicken and waffles! Come on please, indulge me...I mentioned that I wanted to love this place and I'm still trying to find that love. I do go back out of my own volition and enjoy the food they serve but wish that the portions were larger and some truly indulgent options were available on the menu. Come on chicken and waffles/french toast and bacon! Aside from that, this is a perfectly charming place to have brunch, with its industrial chic decor and tucked away location, it's a lovely little gem that you'd never guess was in such a central location!

MLJJg3DaUagAmNv21Ulofw.text: Pretty average overall. I have been to this and one other BC in the past week - primarily due to the fact they open early. Service at one was good and horrible at this location. Food at both was quite poor. I have had both the waffles and chicken as well as the breakfast burrito and both were so average in taste I was amazed. The breakfast burrito, in particular, was basically inedible. The fruit juice drinks are good and interesting and coffee was also fine but for the line-up to get in and general hype, there are better places in London.

9bXMsMbh79m7b5ar-sHK7w.text: Why is it that in every Breakfast Club you have to queue? If people are queuing then it must be really good. The selection of breakfasts are good and the quality is good, but I wouldn't queue up again to go here, there are many other places in London you can get that quality of brunch for the same amount of money.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

WAMPmnhXvb0TMIUVTBR0Iw.text: Came here after a few drinks at sushisamba, was a late evening and needed some greasy food so I opted for the veggie all American brekkie, whilst my friends all got burgers. Have to say was the best brekkie consisting of two fried eggs, pancakes with maple syrup, a veggie sausage, roastie potatoes and mushrooms. My plate was nearly finished, a great pick me up and setting me off for bed. Unfortunately we didn't get a chance to visit the mayor, but definitely next time. The wings were also the best, that sauce really made them, so juicy, tender, fall off the bone. The burgers were good and filling. It is recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Veggie all american, nachos and buffalo wings

CP2rQbEWeDCfTqmWz5U68g.text: Love this place! A little piece of the US in central London :-)

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Love this place! A little slice of the US in the city.

5MFzmxCk9XfGHpK7-Y2FAg.text: I hardly write reviews. But this was terrible service. I waited 30-40 minutes after placing my order without coffee without food, no one asked what I was waiting for or even made eye contact with me. My waitress seemed to be on break based on the fact that she took my order and was then sitting at a table chatting with someone else which is fine, but you can't leave customers starving. Maybe it was because I was of darker complexion...? But I like to think they offer this poor service universally to everyone.

xWbdSRvase3UoxZKVVPkpw.text: Worth the wait! Came here with my two sisters while visiting London. While waiting in the queue there was plenty notes, photos and art to look at and keep us occupied. Once seated we all ended up ordering the poached eggs with avocado and toast with bacon. As an avocado lover this was the perfect dish, they put SO much! It was delicious and a nice start to our day of adventures.

G8BpQJSPkBHnfFN_j13Hig.text: Best place for brunch ever !!!!! The whole experience is fun from the hidden red fridge door that leads to a secret bar downstairs to the pinned photos of customers at the entry to the funky tables ! The food and juices are delicious ! My favorite is the "all American" you're never disappointed! Clearly one of the best detox brunch place on a sunday in London

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The best meal ever ! Perfect Brunch experience !!

s0INGeR10d0Hf61x5Q_jZQ.text: I heard good things about this place before coming, but was greatly disappointed. Line took 45 mins to get in, food took another 45 minutes after ordering. The food I received was mediocre and cold, definitely not worth the time or money.

I_DmPYvFpAn-PfMyS7BaAQ.text: Didn't have a terrible long wait. Food was delicious, very good cappuccino. Kids liked it too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast mojito

Gz-wns3p9J2JH1EMhX6liQ.text: Stopped by to see the mayor on a Friday night, but unfortunately the mayor was fully booked for a while so my friend and I had to wait standby. We decided to sit down and have some coffee and desserts while we waited. We ordered a latte, espresso, Apple Pie and Custard, and the the Banoffee Pie with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Delish!Fortunately, we only had to wait around for maybe 30 minutes before it was our turn to meet the mayor! ;)

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Latte and espresso
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Banoffee Pie and Apple Pie!

UxSZBE204N0YEMkJpCUKjg.text: A-OK breakfast joint near Old Spitafields Market. Loved the retro decorations and the great service. My mom and I got simple but cheap / cheerful London breakfast fare - a porridge with tea for myself and the sausage butty for her. Porridge was a bit dry but the flavor was great and very rich. The tea also came unlimited. Sausage butty was solid. Will come back next time I'm in the area to try some of their heartier options

PxEbAnXxIsnFJiLsJylLWQ.text: I was so excited to try this location out while in London, but unfortunately the service was just terrible.The wait to be seated didn't bother me at all, but after we were seated, we waited forty minutes to order, while tables who had come in with us ordered and received their food all around us. My husband ordered white tea and got English breakfast tea with milk. When he clarified that he meant the kind of white tea that is actually white tea leaves the waitress insisted that black tea with milk IS white tea. We get this sort of confusion a lot in the States, where tea drinking is still not really well understood, but this is the first time anyone anywhere in the UK has not understood what white tea leaves are. He doesn't drink black tea, but the waitress was so convinced that he had gotten the right thing that we wound up paying for it anyway. The extra-strange part: we checked online later, and the specific tea he was trying to order ("Whiter than White") IS white tea leaves, advertised as such by the manufacturer. The most amusing/annoying tea snafu I've experienced since someone in North Carolina tried to convince me that rooibos is caffeinated.I ordered greek yoghurt with granola. The waitress even repeated it back: "Greek yoghurt?" and to be sure I pointed to it on the menu and said, "Yes, greek yoghurt". What came out was fruit salad with a scoop of what might have been yoghurt on it. I didn't want to be the complete moron who doesn't understand how yoghurt is served in the UK, so instead I was the moron who eats fruit salad for breakfast instead of what I ordered. I was tired, hungry and I really didn't feel like going another round with the waitress, so I figured better be the less stressful kind of moron. But it was a bummer.The food was fairly good, especially the items we intended to order - I can't fault them on quality, though some items are more of a riff on American food than traditional American (for example, their eggy French toast is very dry in comparison to what you get in the States). I just don't like eating surprise food for breakfast - I want to get what I order and then eat it. Seems simple enough, right? Don't count on it here.

M53RgKzpL9fV8qWlbk-eew.text: This is my favourite location. I like the decor, the staff, the FRIDGE (wink wink) and maybe I was just hungry but my portion was MASSIVE. I have been spoiled living in California, I know a thing or two about avocados (yea, that's a brag sue me) BUT the one I had in my meal was delicioso. It was so much I was doing my deep breathing to expand. I love breakfast food and this is the closest I get to my brunchy brunch sooooo I like it. you will too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Bacon. Nuff said
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Avocado and poached egg

k4X21A24y9agdWD_pDQfOQ.text: Like walking into a 1950s movie set, The Breakfast Club is an in-your-face retro diner-feel experience. I had been hearing for ages about the Mayor through the iconic Smeg fridge and the brilliant boozy brunch menu. Brunch has become a vital staple of my every afternoon during the past 'social' month in London, so I was eager to see what all the hype was about in Spitalfields.I was pleasantly surprised that this London favorite wasn't rammed but it is slightly in a nook on what is otherwise a business street, unlike some of their more well known locations. My entrance was met with a general cacophony of conversation which was slightly too noisy for my liking, especially as I was meeting an acquaintance I had not seen for 5 years with whom I was eager to have an actual catch-up. It didn't help that I was still experiencing the remnants of a headache which felt akin to a small gremlin residing in my brain and taking an icepick to my skull. You know the one.  However, my keen sense of cocktail necessity coaxed me into having a Bloody Mary. I waited at my wooden cafeteria-style bench for my celery stalked drink. It was well done, with just the right kick. Bloody Marys are the only way I can take vodka, and I consider myself an amateur connoisseur. Yes, enjoy that oxymoron. As I waited for my friend, I looked over the menu, really trying to make the best choice amongst all my breakfast favorities and avoid food-envy. I am not a fan of sweet breaky, rather gravitating to the savory eggs/potatos/crispy bacon often doused in an ungodly amount of grease. The chorizo hashbrowns with feta cheese were tempting and the huevas rancheros (eggs, chedder, refried beans, guacamole, chorizo, sour cream) were a close second. However, I ended up playing it somewhat safe with the breakfast burrito which was similar in ingredients with the latter huevas rancheros but featuring scrambled and with spicy pepper sauce. No diners remorse here! Large American style helping which I barely finished and which complemented my Blood M well. The chorizo pieces were not overwhelming to the overall flavor. Also, they were generous with the guac which I appreciated as its creaminess along with the acidic sour cream really elevated this dish. Another morning dog bite assuaged by the power of brunch.

dNPhbfIqdeTTZ7m7845BJw.text: Quirky, good atmosphere and packed on a Saturday morning when i went there to Break my Fast. However it came with a 20 minute wait before we could be seated. The staff were friendly and accommodative., I have to say this cos HD asked for one fried egg and one poached egg with his All American Breakfast. I ended up having the Veg All American ( yup they have a veg option ) ., I was expecting the typical fake meat sausage which wasn't the case this ended by being  something deep fried all crispy on the outside and under cooked batter on the inside.  :( Meeh.Decent sized portions Yes,  American big No.Perfectly poached eggs' We'll meet again.

M6J3j4QNFY05cThFW5-6nw.text: I am so very proud to consider myself a member of The Breakfast Club! Of course this is a self-dubbed title, but nonetheless I'm sure that my badge and decoder ring are en route to my residence as we speak.The Breakfast Club is definitely a gem in this city. From the second you walk in you are engulfed in the fun-loving atmosphere. The decor gives off a funky vibe that'll have you thinking you're John bender himself. The staff are super chill and cool. The way they interact with each other is as if they are really in a close-knit club, and they make you feel like a member as well.For my dish I decided to dine on the Chorizo Hash (Chorizo, grilled peppers,mushrooms, caramlised crushed potatoes, poached egg with a lemon & feta sauce). Now I have to admit when I first tasted the lemon & feta sauce, by itself, I was worried. The sauce was great, but I didn't think it was going to mesh well with the other flavors in the dish. Send me to detention now because I was absolutely wrong for thinking such a thing. The freshness and tang of the sauce provided a beautiful compliment to the spicy chorizo in the dish.The best thing about this place however is going to see the Mayor. The mayor's place is very swaggy, but be careful because he/she doesn't play around with their drinks. Probably the greatest mayor I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. Can't wait to sit down for another drink.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Chorizo Hash

fmHLukLhwM5IFYrWKLAtlQ.text: The happy hour large wine is the same (or less) than a regular large. I saw my colleague's drink was bigger, and the waiter did correct it. See photos for scale.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Happy hour "large" red wine. A ripoff. Not two for one.
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Regular large red wine.

bYbQunVP2pDz_In1RNXkZQ.text: The service here is stellar! They politely told us there would be a fifteen minute wait & shortly after we were escorted to our table.It was my first time having an English breakfast, but it was in no way a disappointment. Get the full Monty dish! With poached eggs to dip your bread into!Also there's a cool neon light perfect for that insta pic you've been needing to post!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

FcGrMdqZPQQY6Hx2MdK0LA.text: Popular spot, but doesn't deliver. Two of us ordered the "berries and waffle" it was terrible. Came out room temperature at best, inedible. The other person in our party ordered a breakfast sandwich and it was good to average. Won't came back here again.

j_j5-RHCTZ9mDbaSmRpg6w.text: Lovely joint for a drink with friends and even better if you have dinner there and then proceed to the secret underground bar that is access through the special fridge in the middle of the restaurant!Had the berry pancake under the breakfast section there. Loved it and actually reminds me a bit about McDonald's hot cakes!The shakes were great and chilli fries were awesome! The staffs there are nice and all in all a great place!Of course, being a breakfast club you kinda already know what you will be getting so don't act surprise if you don't see your favourite dish.Tip- if you want to access underground secret bar make sure you put your name down for the queue early!

A_dz3_YSrmCJI6gg_LRxLA.text: I knew there was going to be a long old queue at the Liverpool Street BC on a Saturday at 11am so I was prepared. My bf, his mum & his bro however were not. We were lucky that it wasn't raining as the queue was 30-40 deep and snaking down the road, however in the end we only queued 45 minutes (I'd expected over an hour). We were sat by the door on high tables so it was a bit chilly, uncomfortable and there was no back support - be-warned when being offered these. The decor is quirky and very shabby chic and it had a good buzz but there were actually quite a few tables that were free - perhaps they needed the kitchen to catch up?We were asked immediately if we wanted a drink, however hadn't even had a chance to look at the menu. We all went for teas or coffees which came in good time. We then ordered our food. This is when the reaaaaal wait began. It got to about 30 minutes and everyone around us had got their food. The waiter hadn't even noticed so we called him over and he went to find out where our food was... well the order hadn't even been given in! Thanks then! Another waiter came over, profusely apologised, tole us the food would be on the house and then asked us if we would like another drink. This time I went for one of the juices. They are pricey but without the food on the bill I thought I should take advantage. It was pineapple & ginger flavoured - very refreshing!The food came out 10-15 minutes later and my golly was it good! The chorizo, poaches egg muffin is just so good! Eggs cooked to perfection, delicious chorizo on top and a little green leaf on the side. The All America looked good as did the chorizo hash.Really because of service they only deserve a 3* but the food was so good and the apology we recieved in the way of free food made up for it! As you can tell this is a seriously biased review! If you don't want to queue for a truly awesome breakfast I would avoid this place on the weekend!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

RLOI01oqYJcsvu_QAcSM3A.text: I've been wanting to go to the Breakfast Club for a while - after all , brinner is for winners. So we were in town (although at brunch time) and nearby so decided to give it a go.First off, the queue was about 45 minutes long. I figured it was all people wanting to see the Mayor but nope, all there for breakfast. I had expected it to be more eighties themed but aside from a Commodore 64 box perched on a cabinet, there wasn't much. Drawings on napkins seemed to be the theme.I ordered the chorizo hash with scrambled eggs instead of fried. The service was good here too, except they forgot my wife's side of avocado and then kept it on the bill. It was removed when we said though. My chorizo was good quality and I polished off the plate easily - I'd added feta and that gave a nice variety of flavours. My only complaint was that I ended up with a puddle of water at the bottom of the plate - maybe that came from the different eggs.Frankly the length of the queue would put me off returning soon. It's not the fault of the staff or the kitchen, both work fast. The issue is that some customers seem to think its fine to finish their meal and sit around for an age taking up a table that someone standing outside in the rain could be using. Honestly there was one table that ordered nothing the entire time we were there and then finished up ordering pancakes between the two of them just before we left. Actually pancakes as pudding for breakfast isn't such a bad idea...

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. I wonder if they're queuing to see the Mayor.

1tenE6Ji7CVSMv-ais4kyA.text: I rarely give five star reviews, but this breakfast/brunch spot earns all of them. 25 minute wait at 10am Saturday, not bad. Good, friendly service. Loud, energetic casual atmosphere. Very good breakfast selections. Fresh squeezed OJ really good. I had the scrambled eggs and smoked salmon on multigrain toast. The salmon was EXCELLENT. I've also eaten the All-American breakfast, really good choice, but it's too much food for me. Mostly younger locals seen here today, but this spot is really great for us older tourists too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Sweet lemon iced tea
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Americano coffee
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Fresh squeezed orange juice. Really good!

gDsgIrk9E7yo8-aY8jMBLw.text: I came here with 7 people and they were helpful in accommodating us even though we were late for our reservation. I had the salted caramel banana pancakes and they were fun to look at and also delicious. Their coffee was excellent as well. I had the iced coffee. The service was a little slow but they looked short staffed. The place is charming though and the music is good. Would return for sure.

4sI9G3eRl-Ysy12U0MdzkA.text: Went here for a full and traditional english breakfast. I ordered porridge and it came with plum and apple compote which was quite tasty although not enough to evenly distribute through the large amounts of porridge. Not that I'm complaining about the amount of porridge, it was quite a lot for the value. My companion ordered the full english and enjoyed it very much. They do offer whether you want the eggs scrambled, poached or fried.

urpRNW6Vg_V199SaY0ZGnw.text: I'm an American so I was very excited to come here. I loved the decor and atmosphere. It felt very much like a place I'd go to in Southern California. The wait is a little long, especially on weekends, but even on a busy day we were sat within 20 minutes. Oh, be prepared for slow service on busy days. I understand that servers have to tend to multiple tables but because my boyfriend and I were sat in the corner, it felt like our server forgot about us a few times. As far as the food goes, it's probably one of the best I've had in London. I love the Chorizo Hash and I think they have reasonably sized portions (though still slightly smaller than American portions, but who needs that much food anyway??). Will definitely come back here again the next time I visit and craving a hearty American breakfast.

n8RJ5FfluNBNCwGKVhsnXQ.text: Definitely a fun place! The atmosphere is memorable and relaxed. The food was also pretty good but I wouldn't recommend this spot purely for tastey food, it was more about the experience.

pxhst4drwO41EPw-5AAD0g.text: Really good eggs royale. I also love the green juice. My only minor complaint is that the poached eggs were a little bit under-done so some of the whites were still runny. However, it won't prevent me from returning.

ZfUM2xZQcq2ymMyxnh4skg.text: Thursday lunchtime and I'd just passed an exam, so seeing as my Dad was in town and needed to go to Liverpool Street, we headed here for lunch. Easy enough to find (and with a cheeky Cat symbol hanging under the main Breakfast Club sign). We walked in and there wasn't a queue as it was after 1pm on a work day. Quickly ushered to our table we ordered drinks and then went over the menu.Dad enjoyed a full English breakfast while I went for the chorizo hash. If I'm honest I would assume that something advertised as having peppers and onions would have more than a few strips, but there were plenty of mushrooms and chorizo to be had so wasn't complaining too much.Food was good, the atmosphere was good, and unfortunately we were too early to see the mayor. It just means I'll have to come again!

XFBfeZoHpOuJE6adElEkxg.text: No word of lie every time I come here they somehow have got my order wrong. Every. Damn. Time. I even expect it. And I do come back, because the food is quite good for brunch or breakfast. Oh did I mention that they comp's each time due to their lapse in taking the order. Although maybe I keep going back because  I know they will get the order wrong each time, so I can get a freebie. Who doesn't love a freebie eh?! But seriously I'm not sure what up with that. Very causal. Very nice staff, as I said they even admitted mistake and didn't charge...but very casual.Still need to go down through the smeg fridge. Maybe il swerve food and just go see the mayor next time. No freebies there though. Or is there?...

u3LeEnaNgyG9Tbvtx2tF3A.text: It was worth the long lines and reminded me of some good American food. Lovely environment. You get to meet people from all works of life. Loved and enjoyed it. See pictures.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The breakfast club all American Slam!

8ltio8YJP4HsMbROT_8-hA.text: Perfect date night venue. Fair enough, the drinks are a bit pricey and the table service can sometimes be a bit slow, but the drinks certainly do pack a punch and it's only a small area so it's best everyone sits down out of the way. I always ask to see the Mayor, I like the atmosphere at his/her place. I've brought friends here and all of them have liked it. The snacks menu is pretty decent too. So yeah, I would recommend you visit at least once to check it out.

W6rMbfg8EYO6aZl30QbuUA.text: I've been here a couple of times and gotten different dishes, all have been great! Most recently I went with a group but wasn't sure how many people would show up. They were very accommodating and understanding, even when our party ended up being much smaller than initially estimated.One thing to note is they DO take reservations so if you have a large group, you can call ahead! Great character, great staff, great food!

ASaeInPm6b-3q_rBURmmNw.text: We queued for 45 minutes or an hour get in on a Sunday for brunch. In the cold. In a bit of rain. Maybe that's what made it all go wrong but by the time we were finally seated, I was a bit over it, to be honest.The music was loud so the talking was all even louder. The hipsters were out in full force. I imagine half of London's Instagram traffic was going through this one location.I ordered the chorizo hash with feta and avocado. The avocado never came, and I never had a chance to get it as no one checked on us until we were done (but it was on the bill. It was removed when I queried but a pain, nonetheless). The chorizo was well cooked and tasty, but my eggs were underdone and there was a bit of clearish goo on much of my food. I only realised when the food came that no one ever asked how I wanted my eggs (I would have said over easy...)It was just all trying a bit too hard and to be honest, I'm way past giving a damn about something being cool. At least I've 'done' The Breakfast Club, and now I don't have to do it again.

Z55syw8OZjGE_6LxYM_A1Q.text: Good, not great.  A little over-rated I think.  Solid breakfast options, cool atmosphere but I'm really not sure why people wait in line for this place.   The avocado toast breakfast was kinda plain, could really have used a little olive oil, salt/pepper and maybe some capers or something.

UtoTA3Fwyc-ekAx8nL-UNw.text: Loved the fun atmosphere at The Breakfast Club. Friendly staff, cool decor, great music, free wifi, space to put luggage if you are heading out from Liverpool Station -- perfect place to stop in for a bite!The breakfast menu is pretty comprehensive for whatever you're looking for -- English, American, carnivore, vegetarian -- something for everyone.I enjoyed my fresh-pressed "Slow Boy Juice" as a healthy vitamin boost in anticipation of traveling. Also quite pleased with my "Reggie the Veggie" -- the veggie sausage is good, they have amazing toast, and their bbq beans were my favorite of all the English breakfasts I had in the U.K. Also enjoyed the marinated mushrooms. Basically you can't go wrong with this dish!Truly had a nice experience here killing time before our train departed. The hearty meal set me up for happy travels. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Slow Boy Juice and an English breakfast tea.

g1a2kPl1ijcDoBez_kyipA.text: Nice staff.Nice environment. Don't have to line up. With air conditioning. Best all day breakfast ever.

M7XenfZjs0TOxPvQU8sGXA.text: We found this great little breakfast place off the beaten path and it is the jewel of our trip to London. The food is delicious and you receive a lot of food for the money. Everything we ordered from the breakfast sandwiches to the pancakes were prepared well and the service very good. A nice change from most of the other restaurants we visited on our trip.I strongly suggest you try the Breakfast Club. You won't be disappointed. Ciao.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

GDiDwm2eCHAwkbsM25owsQ.text: Get here early (before 8:30am) or there is a big queue.Luxury breakfast dishes with huge portions.

zkpKygJcV81f3epylppsBQ.text: This place is a strong 4. Make it a 4+!  The food was delicious. I had the American breakfast which was eggs, bacon, sausage, and waffles. The waffles had some sort of secret "make it taste good" ingredient. Loved it!  Mad I didn't have more. My friend enjoyed her pulled pork breakfast as well. The wait staff was friendly, though our waitress disappeared, never to be seen again and water must be in short supply. It took three asks to get a refill. That what makes this a 4+. "You coulda been a contender."

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Cute sigh
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pulled pork eggs Benedict

eZElRlWY5SI62DXofX1N-w.text: With a long line outside almost all the time you get here, it's a popular place with good food. After waiting in line, up to about 20 mins you can sample a mainly American themed menu. I do like the breakfast club and you should definitely give it a try.The coffee is decent and they also have a good selection of smoothies and juices.They have a lot of pancake options, American style and the usual egg choices. Service is ok, could be better

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes and berries!

Yu6vJZWe-mqNEWo1jfb02Q.text: This is authentic British breakfast, and it is all day breakfast.  I ordered berry waffle and the half monty, all are great.  No reservation, wait around 15mins on weekday for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Berries waffle
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Half monty

K_ti0m7Yryc1MxDBz7I3iQ.text: I used to live above this place but never entered here just seen long que in the morning weekends. I understand why people waiting so long for this restaurant service to try a couple of foods from classic American style of cuisine. I bited phillys cheese burger, which was not the same as one I got  in the US, but more tasty than original one.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

OPHHASwC0zzuGdG4hVpnfQ.text: Awesome breakfast... Wonderful service. Our waitress was very friendly and chatty and efficient. It was the perfect Place to go for a bite after long flight while waiting for our hotel

s_uGtnzB24J1BQgaIVLpSA.text: I have no idea how we ended up in an American style diner in the middle of London. The decor is kitschy and the menu has creative riffs on breakfast staples, but our experience was less than stellar.We entered just before noon but when trying to place an order for their Secret Egg Society specialty sandwich, we were told they could not serve it any more. I'm totally understanding of limitations on serving certain menus at certain times, but this decision didn't make any sense considering the ingredients are used in other dishes that are still available- like all the Benedicts and classics. I guess someone just doesn't want to make toast in the afternoon? But they have burgers and sandwiches available instead? Go figure.The cold brew and latte we ordered were okay, once we got past the other bizarre  part where they don't have any sweetener available for drinks. The porridge with plums was surprisingly tasty. I don't understand the hype here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Decor
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Porridge
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Latte

kmeHck1BjUNEcxVdNzT63g.text: We had a great breakfast here and it would want to be good as we had to Q for 15 min.The staff were great and kept things moving but the star was the breakfast served in quirky industrial mashed with school style seating.

DDWpGKYLNbVhIKtCp_YOHw.text: We arrived in London and needed somewhere to eat. We walked in to a little cafe, but the menu just wasn't what we wanted. We were just standing around while my fiancé looked for other options in the area. A very nice woman came up asked if we needed help, we told her that we came to check out the menu and we're looking up some other places. We told her one of the places, which was this restaurant and she advised us to go and said it was her favorite. She gave us directions and we were on our way.We walked in and we were seated right away. We got a window seat, although the restaurant is on a small side street without a view. The music was very loud for breakfast, but didn't seem overly loud. My food was ok, I wouldn't say it was great, but it wasn't bad. My fiancé ordered the breakfast burrito which was huge! They have a lot to choose from on the menu. I would probably try them out again if in Londo.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast burrito
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Potatoes
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Smoked salmon bennie

q8NtLYxrcWqbWaFdM7zZRA.text: We came here for our first traditional English breakfast and I would definitely recommend it! I got a cappuccino and Reggie the Veggie, which has veggie sausage, home-style fried potatoes, eggs, mushrooms, grilled tomato, beans and multigrain toast. Everything was delicious, the ambiance was fabulous, and the service was pretty good for such a large party. I had plenty of leftovers too - portions were massive.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Reggie the Veggie

M_oTovtCKqDKppe9IOtpwg.text: Very long line for a weekend brunch!Is it worth it? Yes!- Food: Love their breakfast options. Hot chocolate is divine!- Service: Quite slow, prepare to wait some more when you eventually get a table after the 2-hr line. Staff are very friendly.- Tip: Don't come during peak time. If you do, bring a snack because it's going to be a long wait!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and waffle
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Hot chocolate
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Entrance

vSdgL-JK_J-YQxurE8EOeA.text: Ambiance is cool but wait was extremely long and the food was just mediocre. Staff was friendly as well. But for all the reviews I made sure to stop and eat here while in London but I don't feel the hour and 45 minute wait was worth the ordinary food.

vNEURdI7cQ_L-IFC5Cf5dA.text: I will keep this short. I'm English, but live in America. Nothing here is authentic. Ordered Huevos Racheros, was worse quality than tiny Mexican hole in the walls I go to over in America. Waitress was dismissive and did not speak English. Very expensive. Very poor quality of food.Coupled with this, huevos Rancheros is always served with Corn tortillas, here it was served with Flour. My friend had a severe gluten allergy, it took asking the waiter, 4 different times, if the tortilla was wheat, or corn. 4 times, each time she replied quite snotilly "yes it's corn" and then she asked another waiter, who looked over with disdain, shook his hand dismissively and said "yes it's corn". I was worried, so I picked it up and sniffed it. It was not corn. I asked once more, for the manager, who looked scared and said "No it is wheat flour". Coupled with that, even the Chorizo contained gluten, which is the first I have ever heard of that. They don't know what they're doing, they are very dismissive, and they are going to kill someone. I do not understand the line at this place, because you should really avoid it. I'm sorry, wish my review could have been more positive, but this place needs to close and reevaluate. I will be calling to complain.

Y9LZPyI8VPziytugDQ9EZw.text: I had the eggs benedict and was really impressed by how well it was prepared. I also really enjoyed the seasoning on the potatoes.They play great music in this place, but a bit too loud.  It was hard to carry on a conversation.

HOtJSuCLAr9X1kSVmXm8cQ.text: I was so pleasantly surprise to find such a cute little eatery on my most recent trip to London. Atmosphere: this cute little restaurant transports you back in time. It feels like you're in the comfort of your grandmother's kitchen. Service: the staff member are extremely nice and very knowledgeable of the menu. They were also very attentive during my visit... but I went at 9 pm in the evening and there were very many other patrons.Food: now the important part. The food was amazing!! My husband and I ordered two fresh pressed juices - which were made to order and tasted amazing!! We also shared the pancakes with berries and vanilla whipped cream. It was SO good!  The COOL factor: we also visited the Mayor of Scaredy Cat Town. Definitely ask for this feature if you're up for something truly amazing I look forward to coming back. Until then, I will tell all my friends to stop by.

fZdWcxGdRmSdUr1GaS9jxg.text: I came here looking for a hearty breakfast and a way to cure my hangover. It seems like I went to the right place. My boyfriend got the english breakfast and I got the chorizo hash. The english breakfast was good, but nothing more than just an english breakfast. The chorizo hash was pretty good too. Perfect runny poached egg on top. The yoghurty sauce was nice and tangy and fresh, complementing the salty chorizo and potatoes. The bell peppers and onions gave it a nice sweetness and it was just good. Reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is because we had to wait really long for our food (im pretty sure the waiter made a mistake) and also, its not thaaat special. Its good, I got what I was looking for, but I dont think it was that mind blowing.

Cl8AUmFqykyBpcuZHyYI1w.text: Kinda busy, so you might want to get a reservation. But we were lucky and got seated in 5min. Service looked a little unhappy and as they don't enjoy it and could be more attentive. But the food was just great! Huge portions that looked fantastic and were delicious. Huevos rancheros were just so good I could eat them every day. Would recommend a visit

OCAv8GSDu1TBhg0V11I7Rg.text: I had booked a table for a Xmas lunch for 4 people at 1pm. I called to confirm our booking this morning, and although we arrived on time, we still had to wait to be seated - even though the restaurant was only about 1/3 full. We ordered fairly quickly, but waited about 35-40 mins for our meals.. Which would have been OK, if all our meals were actually served. When the 3 of the meals arrived, our waiter said that my 'Number 3 Wrap' was still on the way... 10 mins later, still nothing. The waiter came over again to tell me it was on the way... Another 5 mins - nothing. My friends had finished with their meals (or in the case of the mex mac - she had eaten as much as possible - as it was basically an entire bowl of cheese with a VERY few pieces of macaroni), and were just waiting around for my mythical wrap, I went up to the counter to cancel it (time to go back to work - late!). Even after saying that we had ordered almost a hour beforehand, and that the other meals had come out except mine - no apology was offered by any of the staff.. Even the waiter that took our order in the first place didn't seem to care. And then when we were FINALLY attended to to be able to pay (another 5/10mins), they still had the audacity to charge for my diet Coke!?I was really looking forward to a meal here, especially as I've heard all about it since moving to London - but after this experience, I'm extremely disappointed. What should have been a nice Xmas lunch with friends, left me hungry - and all of us annoyed.

EDe8uRuUa9oNbPW6oDdQYw.text: Part four of an awesome little chain! Hidden down a small little road but full to brim of retro goodness, and lovely staff who are always good for a giggle - one said 'can I ask you a dirty question.. Is your ketchup grubby?' then wiped it down for us. Food ranges from smoothies chocker with fruity goodness, healthy museli and porridge through to the classic fry ups or eggs benedict.. and some more quirker options such as breakfast wraps or brekkie burritos! We tried the eggs and salmon.. AWESOME! Great food, great staff, great restaurant... Part four did not disappoint!

bmooIYVZcLShXT9Vx0o3hQ.text: Awesome coffee place  suitable for breakfast and also for getting a steaming hot cup of coffee. I love it.

g78znuK2FALiyM56efPGbA.text: For rating, pictures and more, please visit my bloghungryinlondon.com/2011/… I went to The Breakfast Club following a Twitter recommendation when I was looking for a decent restaurant/cafe/pub to eat,drink and gossip around Liverpool Street Station. It is surprisingly difficult to find a place in close proximity to the station that is not infested by investment bankers and alike,basically people wearing stilettos and suits. They make me feel intimidated as I can't walk in stilettos and my only suit is gathering dust in my wardrobe. Isn't this a lovely place?Thank god for the Breakfast Club! Part of a small London based chain,it is a place where people with and without suits feel welcome as it's very inviting and relaxed indeed. The design is lovely and unique and so are the waiters. It could become my new local,if it wasn't for the food which is not great. It feels the energy and the obvious enthusiasm of the owners has focused on the interior and concept and has somehow not extended to the food. Having said that,I went to The Breakfast Club in the evening but of course it's called Breakfast Clubso the breakfast might be the best in town,I wouldn't know the breakfast menu is long,detailed and certainly very intriguing,well worth a try! But now the dinner: For starters we had some olives and feta bad presentation and really bad olives. The tin sort,that I am surprised is still sold and even more surprised that someone actually buys. If I pay round 4,5 pounds for olives,I think it's a joke to get served something like this. The humous was served with a generous helping of mediocre flat bread and was itself of the rather mediocre variant. We had salads as mains (yes I am kind of pretending to be on a diet). Both of the salads were certainly edible and although I didn't exactly love them,I wouldn't mind eating them again. The Cesar Salad came with a rich dressing and a multitude of parmesan,chicken,bacon and humongous croutons. I have had better,I have had worse. More interesting was the Salad of Jerusalem Artichoke. The Jerusalem artichokes were very nicely prepared and tasted lovely. I like seeds on my salads,so I was very happy with the sunflower seeds that were generously sprinkled on top. The 'shallots'were enormous pieces of onions which I ignored,but apart from this not a bad salad at all. It is rare that I send back a dessertI would say it has thus far been unheard of. We just couldn't eat the Apple Grumble. It tasted like it had been sitting in the fridge for too long and had therefore taken on the taste of other (mostly savoury) things that were stored in its surroundings. Not even being served warm could hide the fact that is was clearly past its sell by date.. We didn't want a dessert replacement,because now it was time to go to the S*E*C*R*E*T bar. (I shouldn't tell you about this really) And where else would a secret bar be hidden,but in the fridge? Where is the secret bar?If you ask nicely,you might get the concierge to lead you thereIt is certainly worth it,(and not only because one feels so superior being in a SECRET bar),One could call it US inspired,playing US rock and Americana and serving American style snacks as well as drinks. The atmosphere is endearing,the waiters charming and the cocktails delicious. Who would have thought that you can have such a great time in a fridge? No more words,go and see for yourself.

R2ZH6QysDWO4JFvypVEROA.text: This is the ideal place to get breakfast or brunch if you're after the quirky places of East London. Off Liverpool Street, The Breakfast Club is English brunch meets American pancakes! The deco is all about the American diner feel, waiters are pretty laid-back (don't go there if you're in a rush though, you may get a little stressed) and prices are reasonable for the quantities. You generally come out of there full and satisfied! I've been told they also serve diner.

47mgR-RC8IbCAmTl_oau4g.text: THE place to get breakfast if you want that all American Diner feel which I just absolutely love!! The portions are so generous, it will probably fill you up till dinner! I normally order the pancakes and bacon. For £7.50 you get around 7 rashers of bacon and stack of 4-5 pancakes smothered in maple syrup!! Lively atmosphere but watch out as can get busy!!
